profile_positions.description:
• Establish and maintain a network of healthcare professionals, including Key External Experts (KEEs/KOLs), with a focus on cardiologists, internists and geriatricians
• Exchange complex scientific and clinical data with healthcare professionals
• Give clinical/scientific presentations to healthcare professionals
• Develop and implement medical activities (e.g. multidisciplinary medical advisory boards, accredited symposia, speaker programs)
• Attend relevant scientific meetings and congresses (national and international)
• Collaborate in a cross-functional team, involving medical, sales and marketing colleagues
• Provide strategic medical input to brand team
• Respond to unsolicited medical inquires
• Provide training on clinical and scientific information to internal stakeholders
• Support company-sponsored clinical research
• Part of a European project team to implement (digital) innovation through design thinking
profile_positions.title: Medical Science Liaison Cardiovascular

profile_positions.description: I took the opportunity to quit my job to travel, to think about new career opportunities and to talk to inspiring people. As a result I realized that working in Medical Affairs in a pharmaceutical company perfectly fits my drivers and skills. This turned out to be a great decision.
profile_positions.title: Time off

profile_positions.description:
Therapeutic areas: Oncology and Liver Diseases

• Co-develop nanobody drug conjugates (NDCs) and antibody drug conjugates (ADCs)
• Project management, including project design, follow project progress, organize project meetings, responsible for meeting reports, help with fundraising, and contact and align collaborating colleagues and partners
• Present results, ideas and new strategies to Management-team, R&D-team and Advisory board members
profile_positions.title: Scientist | Project Manager

profile_positions.location: Amsterdam, the Netherlands and Copenhagen, Denmark
profile_positions.description:
Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam & University of Copenhagen, Denmark (joint PhD)

Thesis: Design and synthesis of tool compounds to probe GPCRs.
Defense: 7th of March 2018
Main therapeutic area: Allergy

• Combine synthetic- and computational medicinal chemistry to develop and evaluate molecules acting on therapeutically relevant protein targets (e.g. histamine receptors)
• Collaborate with scientists from multiple disciplines working at different (inter)national research groups (both academia and industry) 
• Present research results to various international and interdisciplinary audiences (both academia and industry)
• Supervisor of 6 B(A)Sc and 4 MSc students for their final research projects
• Assistant at multiple practical and theoretical courses (BSc- and MSc-level)
• Successfully obtained two travel and subsistence grants (COST and ULLA)
profile_positions.title: Joint PhD - Pharmaceutical Sciences (Medicinal Chemistry)
